Resolutions To Improve Gov't Contracts Labor Law Compliance

Law360, New York (January 3, 2016, 9:16 AM ET) -- Did you know that approximately 45 percent of Americans make New Year’s resolutions? More than half of these resolutions are abandoned by the middle of the year, but experts say that making resolutions is useful because people who make resolutions are 10 times more likely to attain their goals than people who don’t make resolutions.



The U.S. Department of Labor continues its resolve to catch more labor law violators, including contractors that violate the Fair Labor Standards Act, Service Contract, Davis-Bacon Act and any of the half-dozen...

article_metadata.description: The U.S. Department of Labor continues its resolve to catch more labor law violators. Shlomo Katz of Brown Rudnick LLP suggests mini-resolutions that government contractors can make in each month of 2016 to avoid big back wage bills following an audit or being on the wrong end of a large damages award in court.
